title: What Are The Types Of Mediation?
summary: Collaborative mediation goes beyond dispute resolution to explore ways of creating a partnership between the parties. Alternative dispute resolution, commonly known as ADR, is a way of resolving conflict outside of courts. Family mediation is a form of alternative dispute resolution (ADR) that is used to resolve disputes among family members in a constructive and non-adversarial way. Tribal mediation is designed to deal with issues that are both intensely personal and highly charged. Mediation is an effective way to resolve conflicts and disputes without going to court.
